source.title: 5' phosphorylated mosaic end sequence bottom strand (100uM)

source.description: Load Tn5-059
Wash nuclei or cells suspension with ice-cold PBS
Resuspend 400,000 cells/nuclei in lysis buffer. Use 100 uL per 100,000 cells/nuclei
Resuspend nuclei in 100 uL 1.5X D6 buffer initially. Count and add more 1.5X D6 buffer to create ~250 nuclei/uL
Aliquot 4.0 uL of cells in 1.5X D6 buffer into wells containing 2.0 uL of prepared transposomes
Incubation without shaking
Terminate the tagmentation reaction with EDTA
Store cells at -20C overnight or until ready to sort
Coat 12 x 200 uL, 1 x 15 mL conical using 1X FACS buffer

source.title: Let tubes sit in FACS buffer

source.description: Add 1 volume (10 uL) ice cold 2X FACS buffer to each sample well with cells in tagmentation mix
Make 1000 uL transposase dilution buffer
Make 10 mL 75% glycerol with 0.3% tritonX-100
Make 10 mL of 1.5X D6 buffer

Make 10 mL of 1X lysis buffer
Finally, add 1 protease inhibitor tablet (EDTA-free).
Make 10 mL of 2X FACS buffer
Dilute annealed transposons
Make 420 uL of 4.8 uM transposase Tn5-059
Incubate
Incubate
Pellet by centrifuging at 900 RCF
Count cells
Pellet 400,000 cells / nuclei by centrifuging at 330 RCF (cells) or 900 RCF (nuclei)
Incubate
When 15 mL conical have been coated for 1 hr, pool all samples together using multichannel pipette and adding to 12 x 200 uL tubes
Centrifuge at 500 RCF
Resuspend nuclei in 1.5 mL 1X FACS buffer
Add stain for sorting
Sort 100 cells into each well using BD Influx, remove doublets using forward and side scatter plots and selecting for PI-staining events
Add 10 uL PBS to each well of 10 to 15 x 96-wells plate for sorting

source.body: Cover and store all plates on ice.

source.description: Add primers to make a master mix to 417 nM final each

source.title: Test amplification (10 plates of sorted nuclei)

source.title: Test amplification (10 plates of sorted nuclei)

source.description: Aliquot 8 uL of amplification mix to each well to qPCR plate

source.title: Test amplification (10 plates of sorted nuclei)

source.description: Sample 5 wells from each plate, adding 4 uL of each sample. Include an no nuclei control well.

source.title: Test amplification (10 plates of sorted nuclei)

source.description:
Perform qPCR. Monitor the sample progress, terminate when all samples appears to be in exponential phase (usually 6-8 cycles). No nuclei control may appear to amplify but majority of those products are primer dimers.
1. 72C x 5 min
2. 98C x 30 s
3. 59C x 30 s
4. 72C x 1 min
Plate read
5. Go to 2 for 20 cycles
6. 72C for 5 min

source.title: Test amplification (10 plates of sorted nuclei)

source.description: Assess PCR products on a 6% TBE PAGE gel. If lack of products, repeat test amplification on a different sampling of wells but adding 3-4 more cycles of amplification. If samples appear to be over-amplified, reduce the number of cycles by 1.

source.title: Library amplification (10 plates of sorted nuclei)

source.description: Preheat hotstart polymerase mix

source.title: Library amplification (10 plates of sorted nuclei)

source.description: Aliquot 12 uL of preheated KAPA HiFi ReadyMix to each well of a new PCR plate

source.title: Library amplification (10 plates of sorted nuclei)

source.description: Aliquot 2 uL of 16 different s5XX primers to each set of 2 plates (one per row)

source.title: Library amplification (10 plates of sorted nuclei)

source.description: Aliquot 2 uL of 12 different s7XX primers to each column of every plate (one per column)

source.title: Library amplification (10 plates of sorted nuclei)

source.description: Transfer 8 uL of sample to each well of PCR plate

source.title: Library amplification (10 plates of sorted nuclei)

source.description:
Perform PCR using the number of cycles determined previously with test PCR
1. 72C x 5 min
2. 98C x 30 s
3. 59C x 30 s
4. 72C x 1 min
5. Go to 2 for XX cycles
6. 72C for 5 min

source.title: Library amplification (10 plates of sorted nuclei)

source.description: Pool 4 uL of each well from 2 plates with non-overlapping s5XX primers. Final volume is ~800 uL per pool. 5 pools total

source.title: Library amplification (10 plates of sorted nuclei)

source.title: Library amplification (10 plates of sorted nuclei)

source.description: Mix well and bind for at least 8 minutes

source.title: Library amplification (10 plates of sorted nuclei)

source.description: Place plate on magnet for at least 3 minutes then discard the supernatant

source.title: Library amplification (10 plates of sorted nuclei)

source.title: Library amplification (10 plates of sorted nuclei)

source.description: After last wash, completely remove all ethanol and transfer to a heated thermomixer to dry

source.title: Library amplification (10 plates of sorted nuclei)

source.description: Add 20 uL of nuclease free water to each pool

source.title: Library amplification (10 plates of sorted nuclei)

source.description: Quantify each pool using dsDNA HS Qubit

source.title: Library amplification (10 plates of sorted nuclei)

source.description: Perform gel size selection for 220-1000 bp using 6% TBE PAGE. Use 5-wells gel, and loading ~1 ug of library per well.

materials.name: HiScribe T7 High Yield RNA Synthesis Kit - 50 rxns
Ultrapure SMART MMLV Reverse Transcriptase for RT-PCR
Advantage® UltraPure dNTP Combination Kit (100 mM each dNTP)
twin.tec PCR Plate 96 LoBind semi-shirted clear 25 pcs.

description: Single cell transposome hypersensitive site sequencing (scTHS-seq) combined transposome hypersensitive site sequencing (THS-seq) with combinatorial cellular indexing using customized barcoded transposomes. Compared to a similar method, ATAC-seq, THS-seq have improved coverage of distal enhancer sites which is due to the utilization of an engineered super-mutant Tn5 transposase as well as in vitro transcription to perform linear amplification from a single insertion site of the Tn5 transposase instead of two insertion sites required in ATAC-seq. scTHS-seq was used to generate single nucleus accessibility profile of 36,869 cells with an average of 10,168 unique reads per cell that are also associated with a predicted accessible region. The doublet rate of scTHS-seq is estimated to be between 20-25% which is comparable to similar combinatorial indexing methods.
